column4: Self-help guru must pay Microsoft  AT&T attorneys' fees for patent dispute – Fed. Circ.
column5: The legal woes of self-help guru and accused sex-trafficker Keith Raniere mounted on Wednesday as the federal court in charge of patent appeals held that he must pay AT&T and Microsoft nearly $450 000 for attorneys’ fees and costs they incurred after Raniere accused them of infringing several teleconferencing patents that he could not prove he owned.

column4: California agency probing Tesla on occupational safety
column5: Tesla Inc is being probed by a California agency for occupational safety after a report that the electric carmaker failed to disclose serious injuries at a Fremont factory.

column4: UPDATE 2-California agency probing Tesla on occupational safety
column5: April 18 Tesla Inc is being probed by a California agency for occupational safety after a report that the electric carmaker failed to disclose serious injuries at a Fremont factory.

column4: Qualcomm cutting 1 500 jobs at its California offices
column5: Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc  is cutting 1 500 jobs across multiple divisions at its offices in California  as part of its promise to investors to cut annual costs by $1 billion.

column4: Qualcomm cutting 1 500 jobs at its California offices
column5: April 19 Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc is cutting 1 500 jobs across multiple divisions at its offices in California  as part of its promise to investors to cut annual costs by $1 billion.

column4: BRIEF-Qualcomm Inc To Reduce 1 231 Employees In San Diego
column5: * QUALCOMM IN NOTICE FILED WITH CALIFORNIA  EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT - REDUCING 1 231 EMPLOYEES IN SAN DIEGO; EMPLOYMENT TERMINATIONS TO BEGIN ON/ABOUT JUNE 19

column4: TSMC's smartphone warning points squarely at Apple: analysts
column5: Shares in Apple Inc  and its suppliers fell on Thursday after a raft of analysts read a prediction of softer smartphone sales from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd  as driven chiefly by concern about demand for iPhones.

column4: TSMC trims full-year revenue estimate on weaker smartphone demand
column5: TAIPEI Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd   the world's largest contract chipmaker  revised its full-year revenue target to the low end of its earlier forecast due to softer demand for smartphones and uncertainty in cryptocurrency mining market.

column4: BRIEF-Qualcomm Says Co's Unit  NXP To Amend Some Restrictions
column5: * QUALCOMM SAYS CO'S UNIT  NXP TO AMEND SOME RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO CONDUCT  OPERATIONS OF NXP PRIOR TO THE EARLIER OF TERMINATION OF PURCHASE AGREEMENT

column4: Qualcomm concessions insufficient to clinch NXP deal: commerce ministry
column5: BEIJING U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm  will have to do more to complete its proposed takeover of NXP Semiconductors   a commerce ministry spokesman said on Thursday.

column4: Qualcomm to refile China application to get NXP deal cleared
column5: Qualcomm  will refile a regulatory application with the Chinese government to clear its $44 billion takeover of NXP Semiconductors   the U.S. chipmaker said on Thursday.

column4: Qualcomm to refile China application to get NXP deal cleared
column5: April 19 Qualcomm will refile a regulatory application with the Chinese government to clear its $44 billion takeover of NXP Semiconductors  the U.S. chipmaker said on Thursday.

column4: BRIEF-Qualcomm And Nxp Agree  At Mofcom Request  To Withdraw And Refile Application For Chinese Regulatory Approval
column5: * QUALCOMM AND NXP AGREE  AT MOFCOM REQUEST  TO WITHDRAW AND REFILE APPLICATION FOR CHINESE REGULATORY APPROVAL
